thread.title: Livestream: Nasa announces major 'new find' outside our solar system | Stuff.co.nz
thread.title_full: Livestream: Nasa announces major 'new find' outside our solar system | Stuff.co.nz

title: Livestream: Nasa announces major 'new find' outside our solar system | Stuff.co.nz
text:
Livestream: Nasa announces major 'new find' outside our solar system Last updated 06:19, February 23 2017 
Nasa is announcing a major "new findings" about planets outside our solar system. 
The space agency says the announcement at their headquarters in Washington, DC (Thursday 7am NZT) will detail "findings on planets that orbit stars other than our sun, known as exoplanets." 
Nasa has been coy with the exact details around the event, but judging from the experts that will be in attendance it is being touted as the biggest news on exoplanets since last year's announcement of an earth-like planet orbiting our closest star. @lebackpacker, via @BeautifulDestinations 
Nasa's announcement is being touted as the biggest news on exoplanets since an earth-like planet was found orbiting our closest star. 
The event, will be broadcast on Nasa Television and the agency's website. 
Five speakers who will be briefing the public, including Sean Carey, the manager of Nasa's Spitzer Science Center and Sara Seager, a professor of planetary science and physics at Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Pssst! We've got exciting news from beyond our solar system! Spoiler: NOT aliens. Watch at 1pm ET: https://t.co/mzKW5uV4hS Q? Use #askNASA pic.twitter.com/uHremmTTqK
